The platform can dramatically improve maternal and child health outcomes by creating a connected ecosystem:

  1. Enables continuous tracking of vitals, nutrition intake, supplements, and appointments.

  2. Provides early alerts for nutritional deficiencies or high-risk symptoms.

  3. Facilitates data sharing between hospitals, insurance providers, and government health departments.

  4. Helps governments identify high-risk regions and create targeted support policies.

  5. Improves insurance planning and hospital resource allocation through real-time analytics.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Pregnant women, especially in rural and underserved areas, often face serious health risks due to poor nutrition awareness, lack of regular health tracking, and delayed medical attention. Existing systems are fragmented — hospitals maintain records separately, insurance providers lack visibility into risk patterns, and government agencies get delayed or incomplete data. This disconnect prevents early intervention, proactive policy-making, and timely nutritional support for expecting mothers.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A ServiceNow-powered AI platform integrated with mobile access that allows:

  1. Pregnant women to log diet, supplements, and symptoms through a self-service portal or chatbot.

  2. Hospitals to update check-up details and upload reports directly into the shared record.

  3. Insurance companies to receive early alerts for claims and risk adjustments.

  4. Government agencies to access anonymized analytics dashboards for health trend monitoring and policy planning.

The system would leverage automation, AI-driven insights, and secure data sharing to ensure accurate, timely, and privacy-compliant maternal health tracking.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  1. Health & Life Sciences Service Management (HLSM) for hospital integration

  2. Service Portal / Mobile App Builder for user-facing interfaces

  3. Flow Designer & IntegrationHub for connecting hospital, insurance, and government systems

  4. Now Assist (GenAI) for intelligent symptom and nutrition guidance

  5. Performance Analytics & Reporting for insights and trend visualization

  6. Data Foundation / CSDM for structured health record mapping

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. ntegration with hospital EMR/EHR systems for real-time data updates.

  2. API connections with insurance databases and government health APIs.

  3. Data privacy compliance (HIPAA / GDPR).

  4. Mobile app or chatbot interface for accessibility in low-connectivity regions.

  5. Language localization and voice-assist features for inclusivity.
